column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Support Your Child 's Unique Gifts in the School Environment
#Text=So you have a child(s) that has a unique gift , and depending on your stance with views , you 've decided the best way to fully support it in anyway possible .
#Text=And with the even more troubling task of doing so in a school environment .
#Text=This article will explain the nature , possible causation , and a way to support the gift .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Recognize the full potential of the gift .
#Text=Under any circumstance , If you do not support it , your child will fail to understand why you support it , but do not see it 's full potential .
#Text=Every object in this world has a purpose , no matter how small , it 's there to do something .
#Text=Let your child know you care .
#Text=Depending on the age , the presence of this gift in your household ( or another ) is the physical representation of your child 's thoughts and views of society as a whole .
#Text=Their view right now is you .
#Text=That 's about it .
#Text=If they do n't know you care , their view of you will become darker with each passing day .
#Text=Ca n't let that happen can we ?
#Text=With the positive response of them knowing you care , two things can happen .
#Text=The first one being ( if the original view of the world is above a neutral , ie . happy , joyful ) that their gift will continue to grow .
#Text=On the other hand that gift will either decay and cease to exist , or become as volatile as car wreck .
#Text=Follow the next step to continue with the first option , for the second .
#Text=And if both of these are not a problem , continue on .
#Text=Loss .

#Text=If you came to this step then the reason your child quit acknowledging the gift , is due to the possibility that the child 's subconscious mind made a goal to gain attention from you and that the goal has been met .
#Text=With you at his/her side , they are set free of doubt and misery .
#Text=They know they can trust you .
#Text=Resentment .
#Text=If you came to this step then the reason your child became so volatile is because he/she thinks you are " playing " his/her .
#Text=The distrust has become more prominent , immediate action must take place at once to stop this from getting out of control .
#Text=Unfortunately , this must be placed into your hands to be solved .
#Text=Make it known at their school .
#Text=Try not to make it too known at their school .
#Text=The child will be made fun of if too known , which defeats the purpose of this wikiHow .
#Text=Stick to the principal and teacher(s) at their grade level .
#Text=At this point you have nothing to worry about .
#Text=Try to give constant support , telling them they are good at what they have , and cherishing what they give you , and never letting them feel alone .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Always let them know you care .
#Text=Let them tell themselves about the unique gift .
#Text=Make sure they feel loved and supported .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Never let them feel alone .
#Text=Never start an argument concerning the gift .
#Text=If things go sour , get outside help .
